title: Ask HN: Cable diameter required to handle web apps
text:
With the volume of messages on WhatsApp, images and videos on Instagram, tweets on Twitter, etc., what is the approximate diameter of the cables some of the main consumer services would require if all traffic were to pass through one cable.

This question is assuming: excessive technical details ignored, equally distributed loads throughout the day, worldwide traffic through one cable.

Bo need to get out your inspector hats for the question, looking for a rough estimate to visualize what underground cables are going through.

On Christmas Day eBay banned me for life
text:
On Christmas day I received a nice email from eBay.

  "We wanted to let you know that your account has been permanently restricted from selling because of activity we believe was putting the eBay community at risk. We understand this must be frustrating, and please know that our decision was not made lightly. Measures like this help keep our marketplace safe for everyone. Learn more about how and why accounts can be restricted.

  Here’s what you should know You will no longer be able to use your account to sell on eBay and any new accounts you set up may also be restricted. 
 - Any fees paid or payable for listings that are ended and/or hidden from search will not be refunded or otherwise credited to your account.
  
  You can still bid on and buy items from other sellers.
If you have any questions or concerns, or think we’ve made a mistake, please get in touch. We’re here to help"

To my certain knowledge I have done nothing to deserve this. I share an address with a dozen other people, perhaps they did something to black list our address, but I can only speculate. It is just as likely that ebay's 99% perfect automated systems flagged me in error.

Ask HN: Has anyone taught “no code” for children?
text:
Hi

How to teach kids to code keeps coming up as a topic on HN, but Im wondering if anyone has tried teaching their children and letting them experiment with no code, beyond scratch?

I think it would let children explore ideas a lot easier than coding

What frameworks or applications did you use? How did it work out?

Show HN: Nearly Magical-Automated time tracking,like Self-driving car
text:
First product to measure your work-life balance. Until now it was only talked about, but now you have a tool which can take care of your productivity.
Tool does not require you to record time, start/stop timers, tag time to customer. All of this is automated for ease of use.
Helps you stay focus on you work, while Rombi Productivty is taking care of your time tracking, productivity, billing and work life balance.
